website_summaries.verdict: This model makes clean cuts on up to 20 AWG stranded wire, and includes a small bolt cutting tool and reaming head designed for wire crimping or smoothing the edges of metal pipes.
pros: This tool includes just about everything an electrician or audio-visual technician would need on the job in a compact handheld tool
Curved cutting blade moves easily through even the heaviest gauges of wire, and the stripping tool works just as quickly
The bolt-cutting tool allows trimming of common size Number 6 and Number 8 bolts to whatever size the user requires
Reaming head can smooth up to half-inch pipe
This is the best tool we considered for making light displays or similar technical jobs
cons: The comfort grips tend to slip off of the handles on this model with frequent usage

customer_reviews.title: wrong tool on picture
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because i was so happy that i finally found my loved wire stripper as on the advertised picture. And i just got something else. In the description you have a different part number. Well I didn’t check it when i ordered it... my bad. But! You can get this stripper for $20 from an other seller or the most expensive way, from home depot for $25...... I don’t know... I feel disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Janosne N.

customer_reviews.title: I have a set of Klein 11055 strippers I'had for close to a decade that still work fine, but I liked the idea of a similar ...
customer_reviews.text: Satisfactory functionality, but durability is only so-so. I have a set of Klein 11055 strippers I'had for close to a decade that still work fine, but I liked the idea of a similar tool that could also do light needle nose plier duty. Unfortunately, the tool is kind of cheap. Within a few months it had loosened up making the cutters nearly useless, and then the lock that holds them shut broke off. At that point they were more annoying than useful, so I went back to the Kleins. It's a shame. It's a great idea that's completely hamstrung by shoddy workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: John Bange

customer_reviews.title: Get  the job done
customer_reviews.text: This my second pair of Milwaukee 6-In-One Combination Wire Stripping and Reaming Pliers the other pair I lost on the job.Let me state you can't go wrong with this Electricians Pliers .As a building maintenance worker It has help immensely doing electrical work like stripping cutting wire,installing light switches and outlets in tenant apartments.Oh also it's a good small bolt cutter.This Pliers is made very sturdy with good insulated grips on the handles.Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Pretlow

customer_reviews.title: At first I didn't like em. But once I got used to where ...
customer_reviews.text: At first I didn't like em. But once I got used to where the stripping holes are placed. Whoooo this is the tool. Used to have klien strippers but these are much sharper and I feel like you have more power because of the handles. I'm gonna buy a few more just incase they break down the line(might be years at the rate they are holding up.)
customer_reviews.author: nick_hawaii

customer_reviews.title: try it
customer_reviews.text: so i bought this to replace an ideal stripper i grew to love. i thought i would try these because they had good reviews and a decent looking head. it was a toss between these and a set of klein strippers. if these break ill but another set, i use these everyday as an apprentice electrician and they are robust.
customer_reviews.author: Valentine McGillycuddy

customer_reviews.title: Best made stripper I've found
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased several wire strippers in the $6 - $20 range, and they all had quality problems. I'm afraid inexpensive tools and actually cheap tools. This tool is well made, and the machining is excellent. If you need a well made stripper / plier, than this tool is for you.
customer_reviews.author: R. V. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love Milwaukee Tools, own several differant hand tools, power tools and pipe wrenches. I just had the opportunity to use these combo pliers and they are very handy. As a plumber I often connect electrical wires to water heaters, disposals and other equipment. With this tool I am able to minimize the number of tools needed in my electrical tool bag making work easier. They function great, are comfortable and do the job without problems. I received this tool well packaged, on time and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Bam

customer_reviews.title: Best combination pliers I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely the best wire strippers I've ever used. I will never go back to the stamped metal kind. I read and watched some reviews on this set vs another brand, and I have no regrets choosing this one. Sometimes you can find these at your local home store for the same price as Amazon. I didn't know that until I saw them in the store.
customer_reviews.author: TheLastAndTheCurious

customer_reviews.title: OK tool, but soft steel.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad wire tool, but be very careful what you try to cut with these. I quickly notched the cutters. Very soft steel. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: earlwise

customer_reviews.title: The best strippers in my experience
customer_reviews.text: I’m an electrician and I’ve worked industrial and residential and through the years I’ve gone through many strippers and these ones are the absolute best my old ones of 8 years still work great I’ve just needed an upgrade to pass down my old ones to an apprentice but they are the best
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: OK multi tool. Wire stripper not great.
customer_reviews.text: The Klien wire stripper multi tool is far superior. It's more money but worth it. This Milwaukee does not do a great job stripping wire.
customer_reviews.author: BoB

customer_reviews.title: Love them. Every time I use a Milwaukee hand ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace some specialty strippers/crimpers that were recently stolen from me after 15 years of ownership. Different design than I was accustomed to but am fairly sure now I cannot survive without them. Well engineered (exactly what I'm used to with Milwaukee products) and heavy duty. Love them. Every time I use a Milwaukee hand or power tool the thought crosses my mind that these are made by people who have had to use these types of tools professionally at some point. You can always tell the tools that are manufactured by companies whose product development teams include real people with callouses instead of just degrees
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy duty, takes a bit of getting used to, but after that it's wonderful. I especially like the serrated pliers tip, very robust, doesn't deform under severe twisting, nice!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with them. Replaced my Klein’s with this one because of how well they cut and comfort in the hand. Had Klein’s for 14 years I am now a Milwaukee stripper fan.
customer_reviews.author: Erik tungseth

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for an amateur
customer_reviews.text: They are decent wire strippers. They’re quite a bit bulkier than a good pair of Klein’s but if you must have Milwaukee stuff they’re good enough. If You’re an electrician, you already know to buy Klein instead of Milwaukee for hand tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B.

customer_reviews.title: They listened
customer_reviews.text: It seems like Milwaukee listened to us on our fee complaints on the previous model. They replaced the plastic lock with metal so hopefully it lasts longer than the few weeks the plastic one did. The handles seen to be glued in better. Mine came free after a couple months of use on the previous set. So sofar I'm pretty happy with this set and will keep you posted as to how well they last
customer_reviews.author: Branden 134

customer_reviews.title: Two flaws
customer_reviews.text: My third pair; you will experience these with yours. Great strippers but having said that, Milwaukee needs to fix: -grips slip off within a week of use. Whatever adhesive they use, if any is useless. I gorilla glue them and they're fine. -the spring/screw in the locking mechanism come apart after couple months of use and cannot lock shut anymore. Other than these two irritating and fairly important aspects, they strip wire well.
customer_reviews.author: EO

customer_reviews.title: Picture not correct.
customer_reviews.text: The picture is incorrect for listing. It shows the older version of pliers which I ordered. However, the new version was shipped which has a locking mechanism that I do not like and is harder to use. I have been using the older version for three years and am happy with lock as shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Like all of the 6 functions but the cutting blade warped after cutting a thick gauge wire. Used it in commercial hvac for one month and cutting edge ruined. Wire stripping function subpar. I have a lot of m12 brushless power tools. Real disappointed in these pliers
customer_reviews.author: Refrigerate

customer_reviews.title: Really well though out, very well made and well designed.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I thought I'd treat myself to these multipurpose pliers. They are great, I really like the spring which keeps them open - when the slide lock is in the rear most position. Milwaukee put a lot of thought into these, The construction, machining, finish, etc shows quality throughout - well they should be quality at the cost of them. I'm very pleased, and would buy them again. The wire stripper is precise, beats using your teeth.
customer_reviews.author: StevenM

customer_reviews.title: Forged steel quality.

They have now developed a sticking point upon closing the pliers and I will need to replace them, and I don't think I will replace them with the same thing

product_meta.title: Milwaukee 48-22-3079 6-In-One Combination Wire Stripping and Reaming Pliers for Electricians
product_meta.description:
Size:PACKAs an electrician or general contractor, there are more than enough tools out there that you need in your kit. Simplify the process by purchasing some multi tools that can perform multiple functions. When it comes to wire stripping, the Milwaukee 48-22-3079 is more than enough. Use its onboard template to strip most standard sized bare or stranded wires. When they’re stripped, use the center console to plug those wires in and form perfect loops to attach to grounding screws or other areas. You’re not limited to electrical wire work with this, either. If you need to shorten screws or bolts, you can fit them into the other side of the center console to cut them down to size. You can even use the forged tip of this tool to ream out piping between one half and one inch in width. Alternatively, you can use that same tip to punch out outlet boxes. It’s sturdy enough to handle hundreds on the jobsite, while lightweight enough so you can do it in relative comfort. Why have six separate tools on hand when you can keep one that does the job better? With Milwaukee, you can achieve heightened productivity.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Milwaukee Electric Tool introduces the new 6 IN 1 Combination Pliers. The Milwaukee 6 in 1 Combination Pliers features a revolutionary dual head design for wire stripping and needle nose functionality. The Milwaukee 6 IN 1 Combination Pliers was uniquely designed with a reaming head to smooth out rough edges of metal pipe. Backed by Milwaukee's Limited Lifetime Warranty the 6 IN 1 Combination pliers feature six application (Reaming; Wire Stripping; Bolt Cutter; Wire Cutting; Pliers; Loop Maker) specific designs that allows professionals to carry less tools and get more done.
feature_bullets: WIRE STRIPPING: Strip 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, and 18 gauge bare wire. Alternatively, strip 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, and 20 gauge stranded wire
LOOP MAKING: Two holes in the center of the unit will accept 8-32 and 6-32 wires to make loops for grounding screws
REAMING: Smooth out your pipe edges from between 1/2 to 1 inches
BOLT AND SCREW CUTTING: Thread your #6 and #8 bolts through the center of the tool and cut to whichever length you prefer
CURVED CUTTING BLADE allows you to cut through larger wire sizes than the template allows
Reaming Head Design-Smooth Edges of Metal Pipe From 1/2-Inch to 1-Inch (Patent Pending)
Bolt Cutter-Thread and cut #6 and #8 bolts to preferred length (Patent Pending)
Wire Stripper - Strip 10-18 AWG (Solid Wire); 12-20AWG (Stranded Wire)
Locking Mechanism - One handed locking and remains locked while in pouch; spring loaded for easy opening (Patent Pending)
Rust Protection - Increases tool life by reducing corrosion
